channel.title: Attacking Program (C2 Server) on Tux Fan Club Docs
channel.description: Recent content in Attacking Program (C2 Server) on Tux Fan Club Docs

item.title: Overview
item.description:
Attacking Program Overview link

Professional C2 (Command & Control) server built with Node.js providing CLI interface for managing EpiRootkit connections.

Quick Start link

 # Install dependencies and start
cd attacking_program
pnpm install
pnpm start

# Server output
# ✓ Server started on port 4444
# ✓ Web interface started on port 3000

Architecture link

Core Components link

  • CLI Interface: Vorpal.js-based interactive command system
  • C2 Server: TCP server handling rootkit connections on port 4444
  • Web Interface: Express.js REST API with Socket.IO on port 3000
  • Client Manager: Connection lifecycle and authentication management
  • Event System: Real-time event handling and logging

Technology Stack link

  • Runtime: Node.js 18+ with pnpm package manager
  • CLI Framework: Vorpal.js for interactive commands
  • Web Server: Express.js with Socket.IO for real-time updates
  • Encryption: XOR cipher implementation (configurable)

Core Features link

Client Management link

 ls # List connected clients
auth <client> <password> # Authenticate with SHA-512 verification
status <client> # Get comprehensive rootkit status
keepalive <client> # Check connection health

Remote Operations link

 exec <client> <command> # Execute shell commands
upload <client> <local> [remote] # Upload files to victim
download <client> <remote> [local] # Download files from victim

Configuration Management link

 config <client> # Interactive configuration menu
persist <client> [action] # Manage persistence mechanisms

Authentication System link

SHA-512 Password Authentication:

item.title: Command Reference
item.description:
Command Reference link

Complete reference for all C2 server commands with real examples.

Core Commands link

Command Description Authentication Required
clients, ls List connected rootkit clients No
auth <client> <password> Authenticate with a rootkit client No
exec <client> <command...> Execute shell commands on target system Yes
upload <client> <localFile> [remoteFile] Upload files from attacking machine to victim system Yes
download <client> <remoteFile> [localFile] Download files from victim system to attacking machine Yes
status <client> Get comprehensive rootkit status Yes
keepalive <client> Get detailed keepalive status Yes
persist <client> [action] Manage persistence mechanisms Yes
config <client> Interactive configuration interface Yes

Client Management link

ls / clients link

List connected rootkit clients with authentication status and last seen time.

item.title: Installation
item.description:
Installation Guide link

Complete setup instructions for the EpiRootkit C2 server.

Prerequisites link

«««< HEAD

  • Node.js & pnpm: Ensure Node.js (e.g., LTS v18.x+) and pnpm are installed. 
     sudo apt update && sudo apt install nodejs npm
npm install -g pnpm

=======

d8205ef9e1984d8455d84e1cada77692ef2857c0

Verify Prerequisites link

 # Check Node.js version
node --version

# Check pnpm installation
pnpm --version

<<<<<<< HEAD
2. Install Dependencies:
 ```bash
 pnpm install
 ```
=======
# Install pnpm if not available
npm install -g pnpm

d8205ef9e1984d8455d84e1cada77692ef2857c0

item.title: Usage Guide
item.description:
«««< HEAD

Running the Server & Web UI link

=======

Usage Guide link

d8205ef9e1984d8455d84e1cada77692ef2857c0

Complete workflows and usage scenarios for the EpiRootkit C2 server.

Getting Started link

1. Start the C2 Server link

 <<<<<<< HEAD
pnpm start

This command starts both the C2 server and the Web UI. The CLI prompt (c2-server$ ) will appear for server management, and the Web UI will be available at http://localhost:3000 by default.
